```{r}
# Load necessary libraries

# Load dataset
```

```{r}
colnames(data)
```

```{r dont run this cell}
# Adjust the margins to make the plot smaller
par(mar = c(4, 4, 2, 15)) # Set margins: bottom, left, top, right

# Create the scatter plot
plot(
  x = data$Internet_Connections, 
  y = data$Accounts_seeded_with_Aadhaar_percent,
  xlab = "Weight",
  ylab = "Milage",
  main = "Weight vs Milage",
  col = "#1b98e0",
  pch = 16
)

# Add the trend line
abline(lm(data$Accounts_seeded_with_Aadhaar_percent ~ data$Internet_Connections), col = "red")

```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)

# Create the plot with axis labels and a centered title
ggplot(data = data, aes(x = Internet_Connections, y = Accounts_seeded_with_Aadhaar_percent)) +
  geom_point() + # Scatter points
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", col = "red", se = TRUE, show.legend = FALSE) + # Trendline
  labs(
    title = "Internet Connections & Aadhaar-Seeded Accounts", # Plot title
    x = "Internet Connections",          # X-axis label
    y = "Accounts Seeded with Aadhaar (%)" # Y-axis label
  ) +
  theme_minimal() + # Minimal theme
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold") # Center the title
  )
ggsave("internet_aadhaar_seeding.png", width = 6, height = 4, units = "in")
```

```{r}
# Install corrplot package (if not already installed)
install.packages("corrplot")

# Load the package
library(corrplot)

# Visualize the covariance matrix
corrplot(cov_matrix_scaled, 
         method = "color",  # Use color gradient
         col = colorRampPalette(c("blue", "white", "red"))(200), 
         tl.cex = 0.8,      # Text size
         addCoef.col = "black",  # Add coefficients
         number.cex = 0.6)
```


```{r}

         tl.cex = 1,      # Increase text size for better visibility
         addCoef.col = "black",  # Add coefficients in black
         number.cex = 0.8)  # Adjust coefficient text size

# Close the PNG device
```
